title: Return type of `cookies.get`
body:
### Describe the bug

In https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/6811, the return type of `cookies.get` was changed to `string | void`.


```diff
/**
* Gets a cookie that was previously set with `cookies.set`, or from the request headers.
*/
- get(name: string, opts?: import('cookie').CookieParseOptions): string | undefined;
+ get(name: string, opts?: import('cookie').CookieParseOptions): string | void;
```

But, I think `string | undefined`, the previous version is more common.
For, example, in https://github.com/vitejs/vite, `string | undefined` is used in 86 places.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40315079/190867844-190e97ac-482f-42ae-9273-e6b8fd0e0758.png)


But `string | void` is not used anywhere.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40315079/190867882-08131641-36d6-4812-b546-8cf6862f6f74.png)


(FYI, `string | void` is not assignable to type `string | undefined`)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40315079/190867001-2e68aecd-3291-4436-bba9-8a0ab7851d33.png)

Sorry if my understanding of TypeScript is insufficient.

Thanks.

### Reproduction

https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?ssl=7&ssc=1&pln=7&pc=10#code/MYewdgzgLgBKIGsCWBTCMC8MDeAoGBMA5ilAFwwAUYAhgLYoXQBOSYRAlE1K+zAD4wAbiCQATTAD4YAcgBmIEDNwBfXOtCRY47ryICYAVzBiUctiglZ4yNADoSUSjMMQUzALTiZHfIQD0-jAAegD8QA

### Logs

_No response_
